intro: Lepidium howei-insulae, commonly known as the island cress, is a small flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the unique environmental conditions of its habitat. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
